title: What gamming mouse and headset should i get.
body:
Soon im going to purchase a gamming mouse and a gamming headset,

The only games i play is
Mainly league of legends
Sometimes combat arms
and other games like maplestory, minecraft, Terra rising and such.


Im also looking for a headset that is comfortable to wear over long periods of time and has a crystal clear mic and pref surround sounds, 

Also could you tell me the avg price if u can :O

EDIT:trying to spend less then $100 on each

replies.body: depends on how much you want to spend I picked up a pair for $90 in AUS nice sound inbuilt mic able to adjust bass chat and volume on headphones really comfy as well but it all depends on how much u wanna spend
Btw i am still on Windows 7 :3
2008 Macintosh Keyboard standard edition. 2008 Macintosh Mouse standard edition. 2008 Macintosh built in webcam. 2008 Macintosh ear phones.

im getting used to me Naga after i had a Abyssus and im starting to use the buttons a lot more on the mouse. 
As for headset, dont get any Turtle Beach Headsets atm. Since Micro$oft forced everyone on Win8 to update to Win8.1, Turtle Beach Headsets like my Z22s' mic doesnt work due to Driver issues that neither company is willing to admit despite mass consumer backlash.

I have a DeathAdder and a Logitech G430, the DeathAdder is freakin amazing i love it the second i plugged it in and put my hand on it i felt comfortable with it immediately, the G430 is pretty good though the customer service is %%%%ed the actual headset itself is rather good, better than them %%%%ty Krakens, both these came with a nice 2 year warranty as well which is pretty nice.
for a headset you can't go past astros but they range from $400 upwards and you dont really need a gaming mouse unless you play competitively even then alot of people don't use them

> [{quoted}](name=Knuuckles,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=V5A8adnA,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2014-12-18T11:41:31.532+0000)
>
> for a headset you can't go past astros but they range from $400 upwards and you dont really need a gaming mouse unless you play competitively even then alot of people don't use them

good mouse > good headset. especially for league.

> [{quoted}](name=GoldenTomat0,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=V5A8adnA,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2014-12-18T11:49:45.430+0000)
>
> good mouse > good headset. especially for league.

debatable, its impossible to play more than one game in a row with a bad headset and you really can live without a gaming mouse

Audio is so unimportant for league that you'd have to be stupid to buy a headset over $100 just for it. A quality mouse will get you so much further than a headset.

Try playing with no audio your next game, see how it won't affect your gameplay at all. It's just there for the sake of it and to increase awareness which a $10 pair can do.

Mouse > Keyboard > Monitor> Headset

Topkek at those games you listed. None of those require a good competitive mouse aside from league.

Don't go all out on a headset, "gaming" headsets are very overpriced and provide little audio difference. Just get a regular headset.

For a mouse, go for maybe a Razer Deathadder.
